conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the rod and induced EMF due to motion in magnetic field
Gravitational force acts downward given by F_g = mg
Magnetic force due to induced current acts upward opposing rod motion
Induced EMF magnitude is given by E = B l v
Resistance per unit length of rod is r
Total resistance for length l is R = r l
Induced current is I = E/R = B v/r
Magnetic force on rod is F_B = I l B = B^2 l v/r
At constant velocity, net force on rod is zero
Gravitational force is balanced by magnetic force: mg = B^2 l v/r
Solve for velocity v: v = mgr/(B^2 l)
Final velocity of conductor rod MN is v = mgr/(B^2 l)
